intro: Crithmum campestre, commonly known as sea fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in coastal areas and well-drained soils, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Sea fennel is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine and cuisine.
